discourse_list.title: Proposal to incentivize the closure of all vaults/PSM with USDC

content.content: I propose to greatly increase the interest charged to users who opened vaults and PSMs using USDC. Based on the conclusions drawn in this proposal Proposal for the avoidance of possible future sanctions  it seems that the best decision so far is not to regulate Dai to avoid any future penalties, but to reduce or directly remove Dai’s exposure to USDC regardless of whether that means that over $3,061,726,764 in vaults will be closed and over 2,173,826,002 of Dai going out of circulation is a tough and difficult decision as this would take a large part of the revenue away from the Maker protocol should it succeed in removing all that USDC backing, or one could simply proceed by taking less extreme measures such as raising the interest rate on those vaults as much as a high-risk asset.

The proposal aims to reduce or remove Dai's exposure to USDC to avoid future penalties. The proposal suggests closing over $3 billion in vaults and removing over $2 billion of Dai from circulation. A 3rd party could provide constructive criticism or ask questions about the proposal.

content.content: cryptenthusiastic:  whether that means that over $3,061,726,764 in vaults will be closed and over 2,173,826,002 of Dai going out of circulation   I mean, doesn’t this partly capture why Maker shouldn’t do this? The numbers are also much higher than that, plus there are many other non-numerical considerations at play, like a hard-earned reputation of Maker for stability and for not making hasty and reactive decisions against the interests of its users.

Some resources:  MakerDAO.world Reddit Thread Tweeter Thread  As some have pointed out in the past, charging a fee for the PSM reduces the arbitrage opportunity and lets Dai (potentially) float further away from the peg.

content.content: The impact of this proposal would create a volatile DAI that is soft pegged which would have tough implications for DAI holders but also to RWA, crypto vaults and ALM strategies. We should diversify from USDC by increasing exposure to other assets. Some PSM options include, other stablecoins, tokenized real world assets, synthetix real world assets and for crypto vaults we can create incentives (reduced SF, referrals, etc) to grow vault balances. With the recent news, we should expect MKR to speed up its diversification from USDC and to grow its surplus buffer but taking this action without counter initiatives would lead to DAI’s death spiral
